thread.title: Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino ‘meets with Barcelona president’ as club looks for new manager
thread.title_full: Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino ‘meets with Barcelona president’ as club looks for new manager

author: gstonehouse
title: Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino ‘meets with Barcelona president’ as club looks for new manager
text:
Comments TOTTENHAM boss Mauricio Pochettino enjoyed dinner in Barcelona this week with Nou Camp president Josep Maria Bartomeu. 
The Argentine has been linked with the soon-to-be vacant position at the La Liga giants – and his lunch date will not have helped rumours of him being lined-up to replace Luis Enrique. Getty Images 4 Mauricio Pochettino enjoyed dinner in Barcelona this week with Nou Camp president Josep Maria Bartomeu 
However, before Spurs supporters get too worried, it should be noted that Poch still has a house in the city after his days at Espanyol. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Tottenham news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Barcelona ’s president Bartomeu is staying well clear of speculation on who he wants to replace the club’s former midfielder at the end of the season. 
A number of bookies have the 45-year-old Pochettino as one of the favourites for the role following his success at Spurs. N'Golo Kante's ex-teammates recall his unlikely rise to stardom 
They were Leicester ’s strongest challengers for the Premier League title last season, despite finishing third. 
The north London side are performing equally as impressively this campaign. Getty Images Josep Maria Bartomeu is searching for a new manager at Barcelona EPA Luis Enrique will leave his position as Barcelona manager at the end of the season EPA 4 Tottenham are convinced that Mauricio Pochettino will remain with them for the foreseeable future 
His side are currently second in the league and look bang on course to qualify for the Champions League for the second successive year. 
But officials at White Hart Lane are confident that Pochettino remains committed to them for the long-haul. Tottenham 2-1 Southampton : Eriksen and Alli strikes see off Saints
